intro: Fagara dimorphophylla, commonly known as the two-leaf fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Fagara dimorphophylla is often found in shaded, moist forest environments, where it thrives in the understory of tropical rainforests.
